docs.abstract: Dr Allan Geliebter letter on Jane E Brody April 20 Personal Health column holds that night eating syndrome sometimes takes place without individual being awake enough to recognize problem; drawing (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Night eating can occur without full awareness (''Peril of the Night''). One of my patients was unable to lose weight on 900 calories a day. Eventually, she realized that she was putting on calories in the middle of the night. Each time she woke up to use the bathroom, she would stop in the kitchen and grab something to eat on her way back to the bedroom.
